Yesterday was Father's Day. What did I do? For my Dad a simple "I love you." For my husband..well that's private. I love my father deeply. I couldn't have had a better man raising me or loving me. He's the stick I measure all men up to. I married a man much like my father in views and temperment. I'm proud of my father, he's worked hard all his life to provide for our family. I can't say that my father is proud of me... that hurts some. Disappointing my father always hurt me more than when I ended up getting spanked for some transgression. My father often told us stories of his younger life. How hard it was, how he wanted so much better for us. I heard about alcoholic step fathers..yes, fathers. I heard about his grandmother raising him and the love in his voice when he spoke of her. I even heard of his tours in Vietnam. He felt it was important to pass down even those stories to us, my brother and I. "Someday you are going to have to remember these. They are your history and mine. Good, bad and inbetween, girl. Don't ever forget and don't ever let me forget....if the time comes." ~~~ Wayne Evans, my father. I love you Daddy.

Well this weekend went pretty fast. Typical Sunday table top game that was just short of being totally boring. Only because I'm rather burnt out on D&D at the moment. I really have to say though that this time around the DM did a pretty good job considering. I play TT twice a week on Fridays and Sundays. They can run the gamut of D&D to Cyberpunk to whatever catches the player's eye for the week. I like the variety and it's different than online irc roleplaying chats. You get the occasional dickhead but usually all it takes is for the party to kill their character once before they get the idea. They either pack up and leave or they adapt. I've been roleplaying for 17 years now. I started at the tender age of 15. You learn a few things along the way in all those years. Like how to make good survivability choices for your character.. when to run...when to fight...when to beg for your life. Of course with some you have a character who would make a stupid decision, you just have to know how to get said character out of the hole they dig themselves into. This includes knowing when to put pride aside and do what you must. Anybody who has a character that isn't able to adapt has a character that has a built in timer that will eventually go off and say -DONE-. I love seeing some player come up with a saying like "He would NEVER do that" I just have to play devil's advocate and say ....never?? never ever?? It's fun to play with those, they tend to die quick but you can use them as efficient cannon fodder until such time as they expire because their character "just wouldn't do that."

Interesting Bit Of Stuff Ever have a church group show up at your door and try to give you the "Good News"? Isn't it just so Annoying? Here's a few questions to throw back at them as they try so hard to get you to change your faith. The questions follow unchanged from their original authoring. Under no circumstances will "The LORD works in mysterious ways" or other arguments in that vein be acceptable. If a question does not apply to your particular sect, explain why. 1. If your god did not want Adam and Eve to eat from the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil, why did he put the tree in the garden of Eden (and at the center, no less)? Was it for shade? If so, why use something so dangerous as a shade tree? If the purpose of the tree was to tempt Adam and Eve, explain why it's OK for your god to engage in a practice that our modern-day courts of law refer to as "entrapment." 2. Why is it that the life of Jesus was so similar to the lives of pagan Christs, particularly Herakles, Dionysios, Mithras and Asklepios? 3. Do you feel that the last words of Christ were significant? If so, why do the four gospels attribute three different sentences to Christ as his last? (Matthew 27:46 and Mark 15:34: "My God, My God, why hast thou forsaken me?"; Luke 23:46: "Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit"; John 19:30: "It is finished"). 4. If your sect considers the King James Bible to be the official and/or authoritative translation, justify this in light of the fact that when King James commissioned his translation to be poetic rather than accurate. How can you possibly use an inaccurate translation as your reference for what is/is not the word of your god? If your sect does not use the King James Bible, what translation do they use? Justify the use of that particular translation These are just a few things to say to those that come knocking on your door wishing to change your particular faith. ( My pardon to my Christian friends.... this is all meant as a joke and to get a few laughs. Perhaps if people think about their religion they'll be less like sheep and make more intelligent choices.)

More Questions....yippie Just more questions because I've had a few people ask for them enjoy. :) 1. Explain why I should believe that your god is all-good when the only real information we have about him is the Bible, which clearly describes him as both good and evil. (See Isaiah 30:32, Luke 14:26, Numbers 31:17-18, Matthew 10:34, Amos 3:6, Deuteronomy 18:8, Deuteronomy 20:16, Exodus 20:5, Exodus 32:27, Isaiah 45:7, Psalms 52:5, Luke 22:36, and Jeremiah 18:11 for a small sample of Biblical passages which describe Jehovah as having an evil morality at times). 2. Explain why, if your god loves us all, more than half of us are going to Hell after we die. Specifically, refute or explain the following words of Christ, as presented in the New Testament: "Many are called but few are chosen," and "Straight is the gate, and narrow is the way that leadeth unto salvation, and few there be that find it." If your god loves all of us, couldn't he find a better way? 3. Explain why original sin exists. Why should I be eternally tortured for something that a pair of naked fruit-munching simpletons did in a garden over six thousand years ago? If you believe that children are born stained because they were conceived sexually, explain why I would be punished for something my parents did by your merciful and just god. If Judas was willing to go to Hell for humanity, didn't he make more of a sacrifice than Jesus, who spent only three hours in pain? Shouldn't we then be worshipping Judas? Again this isn't to bash Christians at all since I too have my roots in the faith. Have fun.

Some Thoughts Recently I've been troubled about a few things. Vague fears that rest in the back of my mind. Oddly I can't voice them here, or anywhere for that matter. I'm not afforded any private place where I might rid my mind of these things. Express them without censure or risk of anger on some person's part. I want to be able to rant and rave and yes that means sometimes I want somebody to give me a pat on the back and tell me it's going to be okay. Instead I'll hold these words in and seal them up like an oyster does with that bit of sand. Encase it in nacre and hope that some day I'll have a pearl of wisdom to hand down to my children or friends. Still it's painful, irritating and stifling to my soul. Free spirit.... trapped? Yes, that's what it feels like. This isn't how I wanted my life to turn out. This isn't my dream. This is my reality and is it a wonder that I try so hard to lose myself in fantasy? To forget, for a brief time that I'm not what I wanted to be. Don't get me wrong, this is my fault. I put myself here and I've only got myself to blame ultimately. I've dug the hole....now I just have to stop digging. Where to? .........where to?..........

Well once again it's been a long time since I've set my thoughts down. I'm awful at journaling, in part because I've never felt as if it were private. There was always my little brother and even my parents when I was younger and my beginning attempts were read by them at one time or another without my permission or approval. Then there was my whole teenage years and I definitely learned the peril of keeping my thoughts down on paper. Much to my own shame and embarassment. These lessons were learned the hard way because what I write in the heat of the moment will usually fade or good sense will take over. So..... here I am writing on this where anybody can come along and read it. Perhaps I feel a bit safer just because of the utterly public nature of this in the first place. What am I going to write about? I could start with my marriage. This is my second attempt at matrimonial bliss....not that it's been very blissful. I can say this it's been 10 years...not all of it bad. There's been some reall hard times and some good times. Yet in many ways we seem to grow more distant. I feel more and more resentment. It's not that we argue all the time it's more like the same arguement over and over. I end up feeling like a child and the more he tries to control what and when I do things the more I rail and struggle. I can stand outside myself and look at what's going on and yell at myself to just shut up but the words spill out.... words I know will continue the arguement. Lately I've had some success of curbing those words. Lately it's a smile I paste on my face. I've worked hard to get that far. Realizing my part in the continuation of the hostility. I have to say that it's worked somewhat. It's helped that I've tried to be more understanding....or at least see his point of view. Yet that's only the start......sometime I'm going to have to speak about my eldest daughter.

Scouting Ahead... The smooth slide of her arrow being pulled back felt almost pleasurable. The prey, an unsuspecting elf, was busy casting his spell against some other member of her realm. She didn't bother to look at who. Holding her breath she let the arrow go after taking careful aim and was satisfied as it buried itself deep into the elf's body. She barely realized that she'd already drawn a second arrow before it too was gone and the elf fell lifeless to the grass. A cruel smile touched her lips briefly as she aimed for another target. It was satisfying to watch the Hibernians scurry about in a panic. In a matter of seconds another fell, this time some hapless bard. As she was about to pick a third target she found there were no more. "Raven you have absolutely no mercy, you got that bard right in the back." A tall highland Paladin, leader of this particular group chided. Ravenrede had to hold back the smirk of contempt at his words. "Only what she would have done herself to you. Or worse mesmerize you with her songs and while you smiled stupidly in wonder her friends would have cut you down." She shifted the bow to her shoulder while the Paladin tried to work up a comeback. "I'm going to scout ahead at the Hibernian Portal Keep. You'll get word from me if they decide to come back. " Her words curt and clipped.
